stance_1: I believe my body needs nutrients from meat
stance_2: I eat chicken, turkey, fish, or beef daily
justification: The belief that their body needs nutrients from meat directly supports their daily meat consumption.

stance_1: I eat chicken, turkey, fish, or beef daily
stance_2: I try to balance my diet with meat and vegetarian products
justification: Eating meat daily is part of the interviewee's attempt to balance their diet.

stance_1: I have added plant-based meals to my diet
stance_2: I try to balance my diet with meat and vegetarian products
justification: Adding plant-based meals is a direct part of balancing between meat and vegetarian products.

stance_1: Eating meat keeps me fuller longer
stance_2: I believe my body needs nutrients from meat
justification: The belief that meat is needed for the body is supported by the practical effect of feeling fuller longer.

stance_2: I eat chicken, turkey, fish, or beef daily
justification: Enjoyment of eating meat helps explain and reinforce the daily consumption habit.

stance_1: I like the taste of plant-based meals
stance_2: I have added plant-based meals to my diet
justification: Liking the taste of plant-based meals supports the addition of plant-based meals to the diet.

stance_1: Plant-based meals are easy to prepare
stance_2: I have added plant-based meals to my diet
justification: Ease of preparation is a stated reason for including plant-based meals in the diet.

stance_1: Plant-based meals feel lighter than meat meals
stance_2: I have added plant-based meals to my diet
justification: Preferring lighter meals sometimes is a reason given for choosing plant-based meals.

stance_1: Plant-based meals now taste as good as meat
stance_2: I have added plant-based meals to my diet
justification: Improved taste of plant-based meals supports their inclusion in the diet.

stance_1: Plant-based meals now taste as good as meat
stance_2: I like the taste of plant-based meals
justification: Stating that plant-based meals taste as good as meat supports liking their taste.

stance_1: Plant-based meals are easy to prepare
stance_2: I like the taste of plant-based meals
justification: Ease of preparation and liking taste are both reasons given for including plant-based meals, and they are mentioned together.

stance_1: Plant-based meals feel lighter than meat meals
stance_2: I like the taste of plant-based meals
justification: Liking the taste and the lighter feeling of plant-based meals are both reasons for eating them, mentioned together.

stance_1: Plant-based meals now taste as good as meat
justification: The interviewee values both meat and improved plant-based meal taste, suggesting both can be enjoyable.

stance_2: I have added plant-based meals to my diet
justification: Enjoyment of meat is stated as a reason for not considering cutting it out; yet, plant-based meals are still included, suggesting a mild conflict.

stance_1: I believe my body needs nutrients from meat
stance_2: I have added plant-based meals to my diet
justification: Belief in needing meat nutrients could conflict with adding plant-based meals, but interviewee reconciles this by balancing both.
